Description: The October 1998 version of the HP-UX aserver program allows local users to gain privileges by specifying an alternate PATH which aserver uses to find the ps and grep commands.
References: BUGTRAQ:20000102 HPUX Aserver revisited.   |   HP:HPSBUX0001-108   |   OVAL:oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5549   |   URL:http://oval.mitre.org/repository/data/getDef?id=oval:org.mitre.oval:def:5549
Comments: Frech> ADDREF XF:hp-aserver  |   Christey> The Bugtraq posting does not mention specific versions.  |     Is October 1998 equivalent to HP-UX 10.x?  |   CHANGE> [Christey changed vote from NOOP to REVIEWING]  |   Christey> BID:1929  |     Make sure not dupe's with CVE-2000-0005 and CVE-20000-0078.  |   Baker> Was the BID reference ever added to this one?

Description: lsfs in AIX 4.x allows a local user to gain additional privileges by creating Trojan horse programs named (1) grep or (2) lslv in a certain directory that is under the user's control, which cause lsfs to access the programs in that directory.
References: AIXAPAR:IY16909   |   URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/aix/2001-q2/0000.html   |   XF:aix-lsfs-path(7007)   |   URL:http://xforce.iss.net/static/7007.php   |   CERT-VN:VU#123651   |   URL:http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/123651   |   OSVDB:5582   |   URL:http://www.osvdb.org/5582

Description: The log files in Apache web server contain information directly supplied by clients and does not filter or quote control characters, which could allow remote attackers to hide HTTP requests and spoof source IP addresses when logs are viewed with UNIX programs such as cat, tail, and grep.
References: BUGTRAQ:20011024 Hidden requests to Apache   |   URL:http://archives.neohapsis.com/archives/bugtraq/2001-10/0231.html   |   CONFIRM:http://httpd.apache.org/docs/logs.html   |   XF:apache-hidden-http-request(7363)   |   URL:http://www.iss.net/security_center/static/7363.php

Description: Untrusted execution path vulnerability in chcod on AIX IBM 5.1.0, 5.2.0, and 5.3.0 allows local users to execute arbitrary programs by modifying the PATH environment variable to point to a malicious "grep" program, which is executed from chcod.
References: IDEFENSE:20041220 IBM AIX chcod Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability   |   URL:http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=170&type=vulnerabilities   |   AIXAPAR:IY64355   |   URL:http://www-1.ibm.com/support/search.wss?rs=0&q=IY64355&apar=only   |   AIXAPAR:IY64354   |   URL:http://www-1.ibm.com/support/search.wss?rs=0&q=IY64354&apar=only   |   AIXAPAR:IY64356   |   URL:http://www-1.ibm.com/support/search.wss?rs=0&q=IY64356&apar=only   |   XF:aix-chcod-gain-privileges(18625)   |   URL:https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/18625

Description: Untrusted search path vulnerability in DiskMountNotify for Symantec Norton AntiVirus 9.0.3 allows local users to gain privileges by modifying the PATH to reference a malicious (1) ps or (2) grep file.
References: IDEFENSE:20051020 Symantec Norton AntiVirus DiskMountNotify Local Privilege Escalation   |   URL:http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=325&type=vulnerabilities   |   BID:15143   |   URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/15143   |   BID:15142   |   URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/15142   |   SECTRACK:1015084   |   URL:http://securitytracker.com/id?1015084   |   SECUNIA:17268   |   URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/17268

Description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the (1) diff_addremove and (2) diff_change functions in GIT before 1.5.6.4 might allow local users to execute arbitrary code via a PATH whose length is larger than the system's PATH_MAX when running GIT utilities such as git-diff or git-grep.

Description: Multiple integer overflows in GNU Grep before 2.11 might allow context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary code via vectors involving a long input line that triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

Description: ack 2.00 through 2.11_02 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a (1) --pager, (2) --regex, or (3) --output option in a .ackrc file in a directory to be searched.
References: MLIST:[oss-security] 20131211 Re: CVE Request: ack-grep: potential remote code execution via per-project .ackrc files   |   URL:http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2013/q4/484   |   CONFIRM:https://github.com/petdance/ack2/issues/399   |   SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2014:0142   |   URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2014-01/msg00094.html   |   BID:64196   |   URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/64196   |   SECUNIA:55982   |   URL:http://secunia.com/advisories/55982

Description: The bmexec_trans function in kwset.c in grep 2.19 through 2.21 allows local users to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds heap read and crash) via crafted input when using the -F option.
References: MLIST:[oss-security] 20150122 Re: CVE request: grep heap buffer overrun   |   URL:http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/01/22/10   |   CONFIRM:http://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=19563   |   CONFIRM:http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/grep.git/commit/?id=83a95bd8c8561875b948cadd417c653dbe7ef2e2   |   CONFIRM:http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/linuxbulletinoct2015-2719645.html   |   REDHAT:RHSA-2015:1447   |   URL:http://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2015-1447.html   |   SUSE:openSUSE-SU-2015:0243   |   URL:http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-updates/2015-02/msg00037.html   |   BID:72281   |   URL:http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/72281

Description: grep erroneously skips Microsoft UTF-8 text files as being binary. Windows text files can start with a byte order mark of U+FEFF and then be encoded in UTF-8.  These are skipped as being binary files.

Inconsistent exit code with --files-without-match. Given the exit code of `grep` vs. `grep -v`, I expect similar results when comparing `grep -l` and `grep -L` (`--files-with-matches` / `--files-without-match`) For at least `grep` / `grep -v` / `grep -l` when the search" is successful
References: it exits `0` and when the search is unsuccessful it exits `1`.  `grep -L` (`--files-without-match`) does not follow this pattern which I believe to be an oversight / bug."

Description: Bug when using the --color option. When using the --color option of grep, if the final character matching your  grep pattern is on the final column of the terminal, then the character is not  displayed. For example: [cid:image001.png@01D315DB.011830A0]
grep -o fails to count empty lines. the -o option, which is supposed to return only the matching parts of the search, fails: ~$ grep -o ^$ myfile.txt ~$ grep -no ^$ myfile.txt

grep: (standard input): invalid argument when run from make. The following Makefile illustrates the issue: $ cat >Makefile <<EOF all: echo abc" | grep "b" .PHONY: all $ make all # works as expected $ make all > /dev/null grep: (standard input): Invalid argument make: *** [Makefile:2: all] Error 2"

--with-included-regex vs. e-acute piped into LC_ALL=fr_FR.iso88591 grep '[d-f]'. When grep is configured --with-included-regex, the following command fails to print the expected match: printf '\351\n' |LC_ALL=fr_FR.iso88591 src/grep '[d-f]'
